alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Randolph, Nicholas, east central Gilmer, Lewis, eastern Braxton, Upshur, Webster, western Barbour and southern Harrison Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Jackson Mill to 7 miles east of Sutton to near Summersville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Buckhannon, Weston, Summersville, Richwood, Sutton, Audra State Park, Webster Springs, Bridgeport, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Addison (Webster Springs), Anmoore, Mill Creek, Camden-On-gauley, Jackson Mill, Birch River, Holly River State Park, Stonewall Jackson and Craigsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 64 and 124. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 75 and 82. Route 19 between mile markers 33 and 66. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Find alternate routes. Move to higher ground. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
